title: I watched the first episode of Tomorrow When the War Began
body:
It's... mediocre? 

The translation of a story like that to TV is difficult and I think they took a pretty good stab at it but some of the scenes were really awkward to watch. The way things were filmed could've been done a lot better, especially the last scene in the episode. It didn't feel right because without the first person narration Ellie's actions seemed way out of character.

Personalities were really weirdly set up, relationships are already being hinted at that shouldn't exist until much later. Acting cast is pretty much what I expected from ABC3, decent enough but rough around the edges. 

First episode 4/10, so it's watchable but nothing fantastic yet. I have hope, it probably won't be great but it'll be worthy nostalgia?

if you want to watch it in potato quality:
http://iview.abc.net.au/programs/tomorrow-when-the-war-began/CH1501H001S00#playing
